result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:54 AM Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Montae W Edwards appeared by video.  Attorney Nathan J. Heim appeared by video for Montae W Edwards. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint and reserves all other jurisdictional rights and objections. 
Not guilty plea(s).  Jury calendar. 
Offer deadline 07-21-2022

$150.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.
 - Michele DeGrand @ 1709 Monroe Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241

ADDRESS INFO for Montae W Edwards
Current: 1913 Madison Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 06-08-2022)
Prior: Transient, Manitowoc, WI
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of disorderly conduct-dvo.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-09-22 at 10:30 a.m. B-15.  Bail is set at $150.00 cash with the condition that he have no contact with D.R.W., DOB: 11-09-1971 and the residence of 1917 Madison Street, Two Rivers, WI.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
